name: Roo.HtmlEditorCore
desc: Provides a the editing component for the HTML editors in Roo. (bootstrap and Roo.form) any element that has display set to 'none' can cause problems in Safari and Firefox.

config.name: listeners
allowDomMove
config.desc: Whether the component can move the Dom node when rendering (defaults to true).

config.name: actionMode
config.desc:
which property holds the element that used for  hide() / show() / disable() / enable()
default is 'el'

config.name: resizable
config.desc:
's' or 'se' or 'e' - wrapps the element in a
                       Roo.resizable.

config.name: disableClass
config.desc: CSS class added to the component when it is disabled (defaults to "x-item-disabled").

config.name: stylesheets
config.desc: url of stylesheets. set to [] to disable stylesheets.

methods.name: relayCmd
methods.desc: Executes a Midas editor command on the editor document and performs necessary focus and toolbar updates. This should only be called after the editor is initialized.

params.name: cmd
params.desc: The Midas command

params.name: value
params.desc: (optional) The value to pass to the command (defaults to null)

methods.name: execCmd
methods.desc: Executes a Midas editor command directly on the editor document. For visual commands, you should use {@link #relayCmd} instead. This should only be called after the editor is initialized.

params.name: cmd
params.desc: The Midas command

params.name: value
params.desc: (optional) The value to pass to the command (defaults to null)

methods.name: cleanWord
methods.desc: Clean up MS wordisms...

methods.name: syncValue
methods.desc:
HTML Editor -> Textarea
Protected method that will not generally be called directly. Syncs the contents
of the editor iframe with the textarea.

methods.name: cleanTableWidths
methods.desc:
cleanTableWidths.

Quite often pasting from word etc.. results in tables with column and widths.
This does not work well on fluid HTML layouts - like emails. - so this code should hunt an destroy them..

methods.name: cleanHtml
methods.desc:
Protected method that will not generally be called directly. If you need/want
custom HTML cleanup, this is the method you should override.

params.name: html
params.desc:
The HTML to be cleaned
return {String} The cleaned HTML

methods.name: toggleSourceEdit
methods.desc: Toggles the editor between standard and source edit mode.

params.name: sourceEdit
params.desc: (optional) True for source edit, false for standard

methods.name: getDocMarkup
methods.desc:
Protected method that will not generally be called directly. It
is called when the editor initializes the iframe with HTML contents. Override this method if you
want to change the initialization markup of the iframe (e.g. to add stylesheets).

methods.name: iterateChildren
methods.desc: iterateChildren of a Node, calling fn each time, using this as the scole..

params.name: node
params.desc: node to iterate children of.

params.name: fn
params.desc: method of this class to call on each item.

methods.name: pushValue
methods.desc:
Protected method that will not generally be called directly. Pushes the value of the textarea
into the iframe editor.

methods.name: rangeIntersectsNode
methods.desc:
Range intersection.. the hard stuff...
 '-1' = before
 '0' = hits..
 '1' = after.
        [ -- selected range --- ]
  [fail]                        [fail]

   basically..
     if end is before start or  hits it. fail.
     if start is after end or hits it fail.

  if either hits (but other is outside. - then it's not

methods.name: insertAtCursor
methods.desc:
Inserts the passed text at the current cursor position. Note: the editor must be initialized and activated
to insert tRoo.

params.name: text
params.desc: | dom node..

methods.name: getId
methods.desc: Returns the id of this component.

methods.name: render
methods.desc: If this is a lazy rendering component, render it to its container element.

params.name: container
params.desc: (optional) The element this component should be rendered into. If it is being applied to existing markup, this should be left off.

methods.name: destroy
methods.desc:
Destroys this component by purging any event listeners, removing the component's element from the DOM,
removing the component from its {@link Roo.Container} (if applicable) and unregistering it from {@link Roo.ComponentMgr}.

events.name: *editorevent
events.desc: Fires when on any editor (mouse up/down cursor movement etc.) - used for toolbar hooks.

events.name: *beforepush
events.desc:
Fires before the iframe editor is updated with content from the textarea. Return false
to cancel the push.

events.name: *activate
events.desc:
Fires when the editor is first receives the focus. Any insertion must wait
until after this event.

events.name: *initialize
events.desc: Fires when the editor is fully initialized (including the iframe)

events.name: *beforesync
events.desc:
Fires before the textarea is updated with content from the editor iframe. Return false
to cancel the sync.

events.name: *push
events.desc: Fires when the iframe editor is updated with content from the textarea.

events.name: *sync
events.desc: Fires when the textarea is updated with content from the editor iframe.

events.name: *beforerender
events.desc: Fires before the component is rendered. Return false to stop the render.

events.name: *disable
events.desc: Fires after the component is disabled.

events.name: *render
events.desc: Fires after the component is rendered.

events.name: *destroy
events.desc: Fires after the component is destroyed.

events.name: *hide
events.desc: Fires after the component is hidden.

events.name: *beforehide
events.desc: Fires before the component is hidden. Return false to stop the hide.

events.name: *show
events.desc: Fires after the component is shown.

events.name: *beforeshow
events.desc: Fires before the component is shown.  Return false to stop the show.

events.name: *enable
events.desc: Fires after the component is enabled.

events.name: *beforedestroy
events.desc: Fires before the component is destroyed. Return false to stop the destroy.
